ReportSection.title: 2016 AGE-WELL Catalyst Program
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Program Description

AGE-WELL’s Catalyst Program supports creative, novel and innovative research projects that will generate, promote or accelerate economic and social benefits aligned with AGE-WELL’s research priorities and themes. The Catalyst Program will support scalable research projects including pilot studies, feasibility studies, and novel and innovative approaches aligned with research priorities and themes. It is expected that successful Catalyst projects may be suitable for future AGE-WELL investments.

Successful projects should accelerate Canadian innovation and economic competitiveness, and improve the quality of life for older adults or caregivers.

The theme of each call will be determined by the Research Management Committee and announced with each competition.

The theme of the 2016 Catalyst Funding Program is "Older adults, caregivers and the workplace".

Priority in this competition will be given to research that looks at topics such as (but not restricted to):

  • productivity in the workplace
  • helping and attracting older workers stay in the workforce
  • making the workplace more supportive for older workers
  • combining caregiving and paid work
  • technology to support older workers or caregivers in the workplace

Award Value

$35,000 with an upper limit of $50,000 from AGE-WELL where there are cash contributions from partners.

Timeframe

AGE-WELL will provide investment for up to twelve (12) months per application. These investments are non-renewable.

Eligibility

The competition is open to Canadian-based investigators working in the field of technology and aging. Canadian universities and investigators who are not already members of the AGE-WELL network will be required to sign onto the Network Agreement prior to receiving funds.

Catalyst funds cannot be used for activities funded through other AGE-WELL competitions (e.g. Core Research Program); however, new activities such as start-ups developed from prior AGE-WELL investments are eligible for Catalyst funding.

Funded projects must be aligned with AGE-WELL’s overall mission and vision (http://agewell-nce.ca/research) and tied to one of the specified themes chosen by AGE-WELL’s Research Management Committee.

Although cash and in-kind contributions from commercial or community partners are not strictly required for this funding program, projects will normally be expected to include partner organizations in dissemination or commercialization planning and should detail these in the application. For reporting purposes, all partnership activities should be quantified in the Partnerships and Letters section as well as in the Budget and Activities section of the application package.

Application Forms and Process

Catalyst applications will be accepted online through the AGE-WELL Forum Research Portal. The application consists of a 5 page maximum narrative application; tables for team summary, budget and partner contributions, activities and milestones; and partner letter(s) of support, if applicable.

Review Process

  1. Applications will be screened for completeness by Network Management Office staff. Additional information may be requested if the information provided is deemed to be insufficient or unclear.
  2. A sub-committee of the RMC will review all complete applications. Results will be reported to RMC at the next regularly scheduled meeting.
  3. The RMC committee will review all complete applications and determine their eligibility for support, the appropriate level of investment, and any associated terms and conditions that must be met prior to the commitment of AGE-WELL resources.
  4. Funding decisions will be communicated to the corresponding Network Investigator in writing by the Network Management Office.

Submission Deadlines:

Applications must be received through the AGE-WELL Forum Research Portal by 5:00pm EST on Friday, March 4th, 2016.

ReportSection.title: PART 1 - Narrative Application
ReportSection.name: Narrative Application
ReportSection.ReportItem: Section 1- Overview

1. Background, Research Question, and/or Objectives - description of problem area and rationale. Cleary state the underlying hypothesis (if applicable) and why this proposal is considered to have the potential to improve the lives of Canadian seniors. {$item}
• Methodological Approach - study design, population, design methodology, data analysis, statistics, etc. {$item}

• Relevance to AGE-WELL vision and goals - Describe the relevance and the importance of the proposed project to AGE-WELL’s mission and vision and how the project aligns with at least one of AGE-WELL Workpackages. Identify how the proposed study meets the specific objectives of the Catalyst Program to foster novel, innovative projects demonstrating potential for significant socio-economic benefits related to the aging population. {$item}
Section 2 – Innovation and Impact
1. Novelty and originality {$item}

• Potential for Knowledge Mobilization and/or Commercialization - Describe the opportunities for knowledge translation and exchange and/or technology transfer or commercialization of the research proposed. If there are specific companies or organizations that will be involved, list them in section 3 of this application (Partnerships) and ensure that a letter of support is included. {$item}
• Social Innovation: Potential implications and practical benefits for the aged population What are practical benefits to the wider community? How will these be achieved? {$item}
• Scientific Innovation - What are the key scientific outputs from this research? How will these be communicated to the scientific and/or knowledge-using communities? {$item}
Section 3 – Research Plan

1. Timeline of Research Deliverables & Milestones - Describe the research milestones and deliverables over the course of the duration of the project outlined in the table provided (Part 2 - Appendix). These milestones will be used to track progress with the grant and linked to ongoing payments. Identify all feasibility issues, challenges and limitations, and what the investigative team will do to overcome them. Include a summary of how this project will be managed and deliverables tracked. {$item}

• Future plans to ensure sustainability of this study - Describe any future funding opportunities or collaborations that will help to ensure the project objectives are met following the AGE-WELL funding period. {$item}
Section 4 – Project team and Networking

1. Project Networking and Engagement - across disciplines, research sites, and sectors. Projects must represent a collaborative effort of different Investigators in more than one discipline and at more than one Institution and with involvement or partners and stakeholders from other sectors. {$item}

• Development of HQP - AGE-WELL funded proposals must contribute to the development of Highly Qualified Personnel (HQP) through their inclusion as fully involved team members. Briefly summarize the number and level of HQP required and the experience/expertise afforded by involvement in Network-funded research. Specify expected contributions to HQP studies. {$item}

• Collaborators/Partners and added value of the collaboration - list in Partnership Section of this application and ensure that a letter of support is included. Partner contributions should appear in the Appendix section in the Budget spreadsheet. {$item}

• Other Funding - Please provide details of other funding applied for that could leverage/support your AGE-WELL Network proposal. Funding should be described by individual, for the Project Leader, all other Principal Investigators, and all Co-Investigators, for grants currently planned to be applied for, being applied for, pending, about to be submitted, and all grants received, for the entire period covered by this application. This information should reflect the amount provided in Part 2 – Appendix; Other Funds. {$item}
